alert.note: Alert for Mecklenburg (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 2:45AM EST until January 28 at 9:12PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Piedmont North Carolina including southern Mecklenburg County. * WHEN...Until 845 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 241 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated gauges reported flooding due to previous heavy rainfall. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - At 240 AM EST, the stream gauge on Sugar Creek near Arrowood Road reported a stage of 14.0 feet. At 14.0 feet, flooding of buildings downstream of Southern Pines and Red Oak Boulevard is expected. Vicinity roads in the vicinity may become impassable. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Central Charlotte and Southwest Charlotte near Red Oak Boulevard - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
